intro: Psychotria patentinervia, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with prominent yellow stamens, which make it visually distinctive. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and are arranged oppositely along the stem. Psychotria patentinervia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its vibrant appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
